Original Instruction: Grab a lemon wedge from the fridge and one ice cube from the ice bowl, and put them in the glass of lemonade.
Variant 1: Take a lemon wedge from the fridge and an ice cube from the bowl, then drop both into the lemonade glass.
Variant 2: Pick a lemon wedge out of the fridge, pick an ice cube from the bowl, and put them into the glass of lemonade.
Variant 3: First, take a lemon wedge from the refrigerator and put it in the cup. Then add one cube of ice from the bowl.

Original Instruction: Take the meat container that has the {meat_lang} and place it on the second highest rack of the freezer.  Then take the vegetable container that has the {veg_lang} and place it on the highest rack of the freezer.
Variant 1: Place the {veg_lang} container on the uppermost rack of the freezer. Then, store the {meat_lang} container on the second-highest rack.
Variant 2: Arrange the freezer contents so that the {veg_lang} container is placed on top shelf and the {meat_lang} container sits on the shelf below.
Variant 3: Set the container with {meat_lang} on the freezerâ€™s second shelf from the top. Afterward, put the container holding {veg_lang} on the highest shelf.

Original Instruction: f"Place one {veg_lang} and one {meat_lang} in each tupperware on the nearby counter, to pack two identical lunches."
Variant 1: Arrange the food so that each lunch box on the counter holds exactly one {veg_lang} and one {meat_lang}.
Variant 2: Grab a {veg_lang} and a {meat_lang} from the fridge and drop them into the first container; then do the same for the second container so both lunches are identical.
Variant 3: Pack two identical lunches by ensuring that each tupperware has a {veg_lang} and a {meat_lang}.

Original Instruction: Gather all objects into one cabinet and sort the glasses and bowls to opposite sides
Variant 1: Collect all the items into a single cabinet, then separate the glasses and bowls to different sides.
Variant 2: Place all objects inside a single cabinet, positioning the glasses to one end and the bowls to the other.
Variant 3: Put all objects inside one cupboard, with bowls on one side and glasses on the other side.

Original Instruction: Put the shaker and condiment bottle from the counter next to their counterparts in the cabinet.
Variant 1: Take the shaker and the condiment bottle from the counter and place each beside its matching item inside the cabinet.
Variant 2: Place the shaker on the counter by the shaker in the cupboard, and the condiment bottle on the counter by the condiment bottle in the cupboard.
Variant 3: Move the shaker and condiment bottle from the counter so that they sit right next to the corresponding items inside the cabinet.

Original Instruction: Pick the kettle from the counter and place it on a stove burner. Then turn the burner on.
Variant 1: Grab the kettle off the counter, set it onto a stove burner, and switch the burner on.
Variant 2: Take the kettle from the counter, move it to a stove burner, and turn the burner to on.
Variant 3: Pick up the kettle, set it down on a burner, and switch that burner on.

Original Instruction: Pick the {obj_name} from the cabinet, place it under the coffee machine dispenser, and press the start button.
Variant 1: Grab the {obj_name} from the cabinet, put it beneath the coffee machine dispenser, and press start.
Variant 2: Retrieve the {obj_name}, set it beneath the dispenser of the coffee maker, and press the button to begin.
Variant 3: Get the {obj_name} out of the cabinet, move it to the coffee machine, and press the button to begin brewing.

Original Instruction: Place the appropriate cutting tool for cutting the {cat} skin on the cutting board.
Variant 1: Select the right utensil for the peeling {cat} skin and set it down on the board.
Variant 2: Take the proper utensil for handling the {cat} skin and put it on the board.
Variant 3: Choose the correct tool for working with the {cat} skin and position it on the cutting board.

Original Instruction: Turn on the sink and manuever the spout to wash all locations of the sink basin.
Variant 1: Switch on the sink and move the faucet back and forth to rinse every part of the basins.
Variant 2: Run the sink and sweep the spout across all basins to clean all spots.
Variant 3: Turn on the tap and shift the faucet side to side to rinse the whole sink.

Original Instruction:
f"Grab the pan from the cabinet and place it on the {self.knob.replace('_', ' ')} burner on the stove. "
            f"Then place the {meat_name} on the stove and turn the burner on."
Variant 1: Take the pan from the cabinet, set it on the {knob} burner, then put the {meat_name} in the pan and switch the burner on.
Variant 2: Grab the pan, put it on the {knob} stovetop burner, add the {meat_name}, and turn the heat on.
Variant 3: Retrieve the pan from storage, place it over the {knob} burner element, add the {meat_name}, and activate the burner.

Original Instruction: Take the strawberry from the fridge and place it on top of the pancake, located on the dining counter.
Variant 1: Take a strawberry from the fridge and lay it carefully on the pancake placed on the dining table.
Variant 2: Retrieve the strawberry out of the refrigerator, then put it on top of the pancake on the counter.
Variant 3: Pick a strawberry out of the refrigerator and place it atop the pancake sitting on the dining table.

Original Instruction:
f"Pick up the {dish0_lang} and {dish1_lang} from the counter, place them in the dishwasher, "
            f"and close the dishwasher door."
Variant 1: Grab the {dish0_lang} and {dish1_lang} off the counter, load them into the dishwasher, and shut the door.
Variant 2: Take the {dish0_lang} and {dish1_lang} from the countertop, put them inside the dishwasher, then close it fully.
Variant 3: Take the {dish0_lang} and {dish1_lang}, set them in the dishwasher, and push the door closed.

Original Instruction: Wash the lettuce in the sink by running water over it
Variant 1: Turn on the sink. Then, pick the lettuce from the counter and place it under the sink to wash it.
Variant 2: Turn on the tap and wash the lettuce thoroughly under the stream of water.
Variant 3: Turn the sink on. Then, rinse the lettuce under the running water in the sink.

Original Instruction: "Pick the kettle from the counter and place it on the tray. " "Then pick the mug from the cabinet and place it on the tray. " "Then close the cabinet doors."
Variant 1: Grab the kettle from the counter, set it on the tray. Then take the mug from the cabinet, put it on the tray, and shut the cabinet doors.
Variant 2: Take the kettle from the counter and place it on the tray; then add the mug from the cabinet to the tray and shut the cabinet doors.
Variant 3: Put the kettle from the counter onto the tray, place the mug from the cabinet next to it; finish by shutting the cabinet doors.

Original Instruction:
"From the different types of pastries on the counter, select a croissant and place it on the cutting board. "
            "Then retrieve a jar of jam from the cabinet and place it alongside the croissant on the cutting board."
Variant 1: Pick a croissant from the pastries on the counter and put it on the cutting board. Next, grab a jar of jam from the cabinet and set it beside the croissant.
Variant 2: Take a croissant from the counter, place it on the board, and finish by placing a jam jar from the cabinet beside it.
Variant 3: Grab a croissant from among the pastries and set it on the board. Then take a jam jar from the cupboard and put it alongside the cutting board.

Original Instruction: "Pick the {obj_lang} and place it on the digital scale for weighing, and close the cabinet."
Variant 1: Grab the {obj_lang}, put it onto the digital scale to weigh, and shut the cabinet afterward.
Variant 2: Retrieve the {obj_lang} and set it down on the digital scale; finish by closing the cabinet.
Variant 3: Place the {obj_lang}  on the scale; afterward, close the cabinet.

Original Instruction:
"Pick up the bowls on the counter and stack them on top of one another in the open cabinet. "
            "Place the smaller bowl on top of the larger bowl."
Variant 1: Take the bowls from the countertop and place them into the open cabinet, stacking the smaller bowl above the larger.
Variant 2: Take the bowls and put them into the cabinet by stacking them.
Variant 3: Move the bowls from the counter into the open cupboard, stacking them carefully with the smaller resting on the bigger.

Original Instruction:
"Move the plastic bottles in the middle to the plastics group, "
            "and the glass bottles in the middle to the glass group."
Variant 1: Sort the plastic bottles in the center into the plastic pile, and the glass bottles into the glass pile.
Variant 2: Move the bottles in the middle, placing plastics with the plastics and glasses with the glasses.
Variant 3: Move plastic bottles over to the plastics cluster on one side, and glass bottles over to the glass cluster on the other side.

Original Instruction: "Pick the pan and sponge and place them into the sink. Then turn on the water."
Variant 1: Grab the pan and sponge, put them into the sink, and then switch on the water.
Variant 2: Place the pan and sponge inside the sink, then turn on the faucet to run water.
Variant 3: Pick the sponge and the pan, place them in the sink, and run water over them.

Original Instruction: "Place one bun and one sausage from the bowl on each plate."
Variant 1: Put a single bun and sausage from the bowl onto each plate.
Variant 2: Take exactly one bun and one sausage out of the bowl and set them on each serving plate.
Variant 3: Take one bun along with one sausage and place them on both plates.

Original Instruction:
"Pick up the kebab skewer and baguette bread, and place them inside the toaster oven. "
            "Close the toaster oven door and start by setting the timer."
Variant 1: Grab the kebab skewer and the baguette, put them into the toaster oven, shut the door, and set the timer.
Variant 2: Insert the skewer and the baguette into the toaster oven, close the oven door, and set the timer.
Variant 3: Take the bread and skewer, move them into the toaster oven, shut the door, and begin heating with the timer.

Original Instruction:
"Open the microwave, place the bowl with waffle inside the microwave, "
            "then close the microwave door and turn it on."
Variant 1: Place the waffle bowl inside the microwave, then close the door and power it on.
Variant 2: Open the microwave, put the waffle bowl in, then close it and press the power button.
Variant 3: Put the bowl holding the waffle into the microwave, then shut the door and switch it on.

Original Instruction:
"Pick up the sponge from the counter and clean the cutting board by briefly "
            "scrubbing or pressing down on the cutting board. Once finished, release the sponge."
Variant 1: Grab the sponge from the counter and scrub the cutting board to clean it. When done, place the sponge back down.
Variant 2: With the sponge, wipe down the cutting board. Once the cleaning is complete, set the sponge down.
Variant 3: Take the sponge from the counter, clean the cutting board by scrubbing it, and afterward return the sponge to the counter.

Original Instruction:
f"Put the {veg1_lang} and {veg2_lang} in the pot. "
            f"Retrieve the spatula and lightly stir the vegetables in the pot."
Variant 1: Place the {veg1_lang} and {veg2_lang} into the pot, then grab the spatula and gently stir them.
Variant 2: Put the {veg1_lang} and {veg2_lang} in the pot and use the spatula to stir them lightly.
Variant 3: Drop the {veg1_lang} and {veg2_lang} into the pot. Grab the spatula to gently stir the vegetables around.

Original Instruction: "Take a straw from the drawer in front and place it inside the glass cup on the dining counter."
Variant 1: Grab a straw from the front drawer and put it into the glass cup on the dining counter.
Variant 2: Get a straw from the drawer and place it in the drinking glass on the countertop.
Variant 3: Retrieve a straw from the front drawer and insert it into the glass on the counter.

Original Instruction:
"Pick up the pan and dump the vegetables in it onto the plate. "
            "Then return the pan to the stove."
Variant 1: Take the pan, transfer the vegetables inside it onto the plate, then put the pan back on the stove.
Variant 2: Pick the pan, empty its vegetables onto the plate, and return the pan to the burner.
Variant 3: Lift the pan, dump its contents onto the plate, and place the pan back on the stove when finished.

Original Instruction:
"Open the cabinet, pick up the {bread_name} from the cabinet and place it in the basket. "
            "Then move the basket to the dining counter."
Variant 1: Open the cupboard, grab the {bread_name}, set it in the basket, and carry the basket to the dining counter.
Variant 2: Retrieve the {bread_name} from the cabinet, place it inside the basket, and move the basket onto the dining counter.
Variant 3: Grab the {bread_name} out of the cabinet, set it inside the basket, and carry the basket to the dining area.

Original Instruction: "Pick up the knife from the drawer and place it on the cutting board. Then place the meat from the plate to the cutting board."
Variant 1: Take the knife out of the drawer and put it on the cutting board. After that, transfer the meat from the plate to the board.
Variant 2: Grab the knife from the drawer, set it on the cutting board, then move the meat from the plate onto the board.
Variant 3: Retrieve the knife from the drawer, put it on the cutting board, and then place the meat from the plate on the board.

Original Instruction:
f"Pick the {vegetable_name} from the sink and place it in the bowl. "
            "Then pick the bowl and place it in the microwave. "
            "Then close the microwave door and press the start button."
Variant 1: Grab the {vegetable_name} from the sink, put it into the bowl; then place the bowl in the microwave, shut the door, and press start.
Variant 2: Take the {vegetable_name} out of the sink and set it in the bowl. Next, move the bowl into the microwave, and start the microwave.
Variant 3: Put the {vegetable_name} in the bowl; then microwave it.

Original Instruction:
f"Pick the chicken drumstick and {vegetable_lang} from their plates "
            f"and place them in the bowl. Then put the bowl in the fridge."
Variant 1: Take the chicken drumstick along with the {vegetable_lang}, put them in the bowl, then store the bowl inside the refrigerator.
Variant 2: Take both the chicken drumstick and {vegetable_lang}, place them into the container, and store it in the refrigerator.
Variant 3: Take the chicken drumstick and {vegetable_lang} off the plates, put them in the bowl, then move the bowl to the fridge.

Original Instruction:
"Start the toaster. "
            "Once the lever pops up, take the bread to the plate on the dining counter."
Variant 1: Turn on the toaster. After the lever pops up, move the bread to the plate on the counter.
Variant 2: Start toasting. When the lever comes up, put the bread on the plate on the dining surface.
Variant 3: Turn the toaster on, and after the lever comes up, move the bread over to the plate on the dining counter.

Original Instruction: f"Put the colander in the sink, put the {fruit_lang} in the colander, and turn on the sink faucet and pour water over the colander."
Variant 1: Place the colander inside the sink, put the {fruit_lang} in, and wash them by pouring water from the faucet over the colander.
Variant 2: Place the colander in the sink, put the {fruit_lang} in the colander, and run water from the faucet over it.
Variant 3: Put the colander in the sink, place the {fruit_lang} in it, and let water flow over the colander.
